name: 12 Labours of Hercules II: The Cretan Bull
description: Accompany Hercules in his quest for the Cretan Bull!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1 GHz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 1024x768 resolution DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 700 MB available space Sound Card: With OpenAL support

reviews.review_text: 'Rush, rush, rush. Servants run for me.'

If you've played 12 Labours of Hercules, then you'll enjoy this one as well, if you haven't, then read this review. 12LoH2 is a casual strategy resource collecting game. With its simple graphics, 12LoH2 uses old greek mythology to convey a simplistic story. But in all honesty, you're not here for the story or the graphics. You probably want a cheap game that'd keep you occupied for a few hours. It's a solid game that requires a minimal amount of thought. It took me 9 hours to 100% it. Also, it runs really well on almost anything.  During the sale, definitely get it. It even has trading cards that pay about 25% of the price by themselves.

12 Labours of Hercules II provides two ways of playing through it. A casual path for gamers that like to relax playing easy games in their free time. Or a challeging one which will prove to be a very big challenge for all the achievement hunters from around the world, as they have think rapidly, beat time scores and have fun at the same time.  The concept is still the same as the first game of the series. A time management game in which you have to gather resources to help you build farms, workshops or gold mines. Which after, it will help you gathering more and more resources to reach the goal of the level. The funny part is that now Hercules doesn't sleep anymore but he's rather waiting there until you can send him to work, like moving rocks in the most part.  The second installment from the series prepares for the fans of the game some new features like new scenarios, 22 new achievements to beat, 40 more levels to play through, original minigames to keep you pumped, a new type of enemies and the ability to beat a score made by the very own developers of the game. But not only that, this time Hercules must confront against the goddess Hera, who has been set up as the new villain. Hera has released a wild Cretan Bull into the world and it's up to our hero and his workers to overpower various obstacles, find this bull and tame it.    Pros

This game is great like the first one in the series, but with an added bonus of collecting puzzle pieces which I thought was a quite nice little addition. It also brings things like thieves, which will steal your resources, and changes how resources are managed. Overall I think it's actually better than the original, but I still recommend both!
The 12 Labours of Hercules series is a great time-waster, thanks to it's relaxing setting and calm pace. The Cretan Bull brings more interesting levels and is all in all a good sequel.
Even though there's no major changes or improvements it still is so funny as the first one
As good as 12 Labours of Hercules!!
Very nice game with great design an soundtrack!

This time management game continues on from where the last one left off. It focus's on Hercules 7th labor of penance according to the real myth which was to kill a cretan bull that was going around terrorising Crete. In the real myth Hercules stangles it with his bare hands. In game i think he gets it to roll over and gives it a belly rub or something. Must confess I wasn't paying much attention to the story.  The mechanics of this one if fairly much the same as the previous. The only exception being that a puzzle piece is hidden on each map for you to find. Which when you find them all will unlock four more levels.  44 Levels, 4 of which involve some sort of boss fight or minigame. These minigames are easy to get a perfect achievement on in comparison to how infuriating they were in the previous one. However this does not mean that achievement hunters like myself will not come across some aggrevating predicaments.   If you are an achievement hunter then i STRONGLY suggest the following. Place the difficulty on the easiest setting. Complete five maps and find the puzzle piece in that map. Do not log out when you have found the puzzle piece as you MUST complete the map you are on. Once you have the 5 puzzle piece achievement, turn the difficulty of the maps up and start earning three stars on all the maps. Remember you have to get all achievements on one profile. Hopefully that will save you from doing two or three walkthroughs of this game like I had to.  Last thing worth mentioning is the fact that they have added a Developers record time which you must pass at least ten times. This is actually quite challenging and makes a good addition for the game. In a nutshell a fun game to pass some time on if your looking for something that will have you in a click frenzy. With all the running around the servants do while wearing short toga's, all I've got to say is this 'thank God they wore underwear back then'.

XIILoHIItCB  is a great game.  It managed to gave me that (ever more rare) feeling of something fresh and new. Even considering I'm at 100% complete 11 hours in, I can say without pause that the 4 common steam cards I sold to pick this up was worth it.
Bought this game for a friend...He didnt accept it.

I have a tendency of purchasing any bargain bin game if the price is less than a $4.50 large latte. I don't remember buying this game, but it's simple and completely casual. Reminds me of those multi-tasking games like Diner Dash.  Not as emotionally draining than a potential de-ranking competitive match in CSGO.
Get the first one and stop there, 2 and 3 are crap

This is a very simple game, you colect resources to open paths to get more resources to then exit the level Very easy to play, hard to get nice scores. The game isn't that long, 4 'worlds' with 10 levels + bonus level each, but the time diference between this and the first it's not that big, so we can espect a sequel not so long from now.   7/10
great way to pass away a rainy day. Leave the kids play on easy or hed into it yourself on hard. Got a lot of use out of this, recommended :-)
Give me the card!

Excellent time management game. Builds on what made the first one fun, with bonus levels to unlock and jigsaw puzzles. If you liked the first one, you'll like this one, and if you're figuring out which one of the two to buy, get this one.
Fun and Addictive. Good buy at a low price.
cool game ^_^
My kids love it! but FOR THE CARDS!
My friend said he would give me 20 dollars if I beat this game. 100% achievements, all puzzle pieces found and all bonus stages on 3 stars, I can honestly say it wasnt worth it. 10/10

A lazy mobile port with little to nothing going for it. Bought it for the trading card drop - I played this for 15 minutes, clicking on a piece of cheese that randomly gets dropped from the food hut. Oh, and shooting down birds. I went to sleep, leaving this on through sheer boredom
i got gifted this, banter
It's good

A fun resource timing puzzler. Normally I don't like working against the clock in a puzzler as it's a cheap way to apply pressure, but it works in this game, because it's how you order your gathering of resources that matter.
:3 Interesting game

Pros: +addicting levels +colorful maps and well designed layouts +Oh yeah, the music. Best part.  Cons: -ghosts are 3spooky5me  I picked this game up for 98cents, well worth it. It's soundtrack and addicting gameplay will suck you in from the start. Just beware that theres only 40 some odd levels so its only a few hours of gameplay. But those few hours were dam fun!

I like it. Surprisingly.  It's like one of the more popular time management games where you need to control several characters simultaneously and try to finish the level before time runs out.  Overall, good engaging indie strategy game.  One caveat is, it's probably not worth the $8.99 price tag. I got this as part of a game pack with several other games so I would recommend getting this when it's on sale or when the price has dropped.
Coll ♥♥♥♥ game
Great Game. Especially for 14 cents.
TLoHII:TCB is a very thematic and somewhat addictive time management game but Hercules is no Coconut Queen.

A simple game at first: just point and click to progress. But you may encounter a few problems on the highest difficulty (never failed a level on normal). 8 hours to complete it with almost all success but felt like way less. Hoping for some new content ?? Great game, maybe not worth the 9€ since it's pretty short, but that's up to you
Great game considering it was 14 cents and it has trading cards.
I have found this game very addictive. Complete a level and onto the next one, just can't help myself. It's also great that you can go back and repeat the levels at different difficulties :)
1-buy game 2-get cards 3-Free game+1-3 cent profit
Fun game when you are bored & has cards, it also only cost me $0.07 how can you go wrong.
I bought it because it was so cheap, but my girlfriend is loving it. It really is easy game and it's very colorful and beautiful.

Fun for 140mb!  +Improves your awareness and reflexes +Feels like you are in a tale +Hercules muscles  +Story after evey chapter +Nice sound effects +Soft graphics which not gets your eyes tired ______________________________________ - Not enough workers - Hercule does anything except muscle showing - Damn thieves  Summary; Funny game and it can make you relaxed. And you can play for achivements too. In fact, i buy it for trading cards, but game suprise me.  * Basic game and good enough for its cost. U should buy on discount. I prefer.
This is very a addictive and fun puzzle game to play!

For something like $0.25, you can't go wrong with this game when it is on sale. It is a casual time management game with nice graphics. Don't expect anything overly engaging or complex, but good for wasting 10-15 hours of your life.
Good casual game, everyone can play. you can give this game to your girlfriend then you would be free lol. missing Road of Rome on mobile device!
Its oky
Nice and funny game
-Bought in sale for 9p -Left it running overnight -Sold trading cards for 11p -Uninstalled 10/10 Would profit again
Fun game to play in order to help relax.
This is a really fun and simple game. It's worth the money and it's just fun. I could spend hours playing this game.  Great time killer.   If you like singleplayer strategy games I say, go for it!

Honestly, this game is that horrible balance of super easy and super addictive. It's fun, but some of the achievements are crazy hard to get. That being said, it's pretty entertaining for a play-in-class game.
This game is rly cool 10 out of 10 :] good luck.
got it for 0.98$ reduction . for this price , its a awesome deal ! pretty fun game for kill time
It isn't time management games, it is time killing games. vol2

To Play This Game You Need a Lot Of Time On Your Hands I Played The First One Realy Enjoy It Not Very Hard At All Super Easy To Play Its relaxing The Music Is Amazing To Lose Track Of Time The Only the downside of It Is The 'developers high score' Trophy Super Mega Hard For Me To Get It But Overall a 8/10

12 Labours of Hercules II: The Cretan Bull has different story and has a lot of new features that didn't had first 12 Labours of Hercules. If you played first game and you liked it, you will like this game too. If you didn't played 1st game, I suggest you and if you like it, go buy this game. And I wrote about 1st game review and you can check it out if you want to know what about is 12 Labours of Hercules. I loved it and I plan to play 3rd, 4th and 5th game in the future.    Pros
Click-click-click. Pretty much whole game clicking with a little story about Hercules. Game is so simple and time consuming. For little money it is worth. But it is for kids.
Simple game, easy trading cards when on sale.
